title.narrative: Shelter NFI provision and prepositioning in Hiraan

description.narrative: This is a Lifesaving Response and Preparedness to Flood-Prone Areas in Hiraan. DRC proposes prepositioning of basic non-food items (NFIs) and Emergency shelter kits (ESK) to benefit IDPs in Hiraan Region (Beletweyne, Jalalaqsi and Buloburto districts). This project consists of two key activities: procurement and transport of emergency shelter materials (pipeline) and later distribution to most vulnerable newly displaced IDPs. DRC understands that internal displacement is the key driver of humanitarian needs in Somalia. Many IDPs are currently residing in urban and peri-urban informal crowded settlements, with insufficient access to basic services and poor shelter conditions that raise protection and health concerns. They remain in need of Shelter and NFIs support for protection from harsh climatic conditions, overall improvements to their living conditions and improvement to their chances to access livelihoods and durable solutions. Evidence from the JMCNA 2018 data that was collected in 58 districts in Somalia show that 80% of the IDPs live in makeshift shelters, temporary emergency shelters, tents, or under trees 35% reported damage to their shelters in the last three months 70% reported that the shelters they live in have no internal separation 16% reported thefts from their shelters and 80% were NFI vulnerable. Out of the 2.6 million IDPs in Somalia, 2.3 million can be concluded to be in need of humanitarian shelter assistance. Increased rainfall since the beginning of April has resulted in a sharp rise in the Shabelle and Juba rivers, leading to severe flooding in southern and central Somalia. Almost 700,000 people have been affected by flooding in riverine and flood-prone areas, including over 214,200 people who have been displaced (OCHA, 02/05/2018 OCHA, 02/05/2018 ECHO, 26/04/2018 Africa News, 02/05/2018). Beledweyne district (Hiraan region) has been particularly affected, with 150,000 people displaced in Beledweyne town. In Hiran, DRC will preposition ESK and NFIs for three districts – Baletweyne, Bulo Burto and Jalalaqsi. DRC will target 5450 households (32,400 people) with ESK and NFI as detailed (3950 households with NFIs, 1500 households with ESK) in terms of district breakdown, DRC will target 25000 people in Beletweyne, 5000 people in Bulo Burto and 2400 people in Jalalaqsi. The targeting is based on need and picking the highest beneficiaries in Beletweyne district whcih is the most afftected (OCHA Somalia Flash Update 7 - June 2018).
